priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Anti-Viral Outcome of Treatment Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C120521

self.title: CDISC SDTM Anti-Viral Outcome of Treatment Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist to describe the anti-viral outcome of treatment.
name: Anti-Viral Outcome of Treatment
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Anti-Viral Outcome of Treatment Terminology

terms.definition: A finding of aviremia at a specified timepoint, early during the treatment period.
A finding of aviremia at a predetermined time point after the end of planned or actual treatment.

The subject becomes viremic during the treatment period after a period of treatment-induced aviremia or has an increase in viral load from nadir above a predetermined threshold during the treatment period.
A recurrence of the same virus after a finding of aviremia at the end of planned or actual treatment.
A finding of aviremia at the end of the planned or actual end of treatment period.
A finding of viremia at or after end of planned or actual treatment, excluding treatment discontinuations for non-virologic reasons.
The subject remains viremic during the treatment period.
The subject remains viremic during the treatment period and the decrease in viral load from baseline at a specified timepoint is below or equal to a predetermined threshold.
The subject remains viremic during the treatment period and the decrease in viral load from baseline at a specified timepoint is above a predetermined threshold.
